name: Glycidyl Methacrylate
discription: Glycidyl Methacrylate (GMA) is a bifunctional monomer containing both methacrylate and epoxide (glycidyl) groups. This allows it to undergo polymerization via the methacrylate group and further reactions via the epoxy group.
typical_properties: Formula Weight: 142.1525, Flash Point: 76°C, Boiling point: 189°C, Density (20°C): 1.075, Vapour Pressure (25°C, from table): 0.6 (unit uncertain), Surface Tension (25°C): 36.1 dynes/cm. Physical Properties: Colorless liquid.
pharmaceutical_industry: Used in dental composites, bone cements, and for preparing functionalized polymers for drug delivery or bioseparation media due to its reactive epoxy group.
other_industries: Used in the production of powder coatings, automotive finishes, industrial coatings, adhesives, radiation-curable resins (UV/EB), and as a comonomer for modifying polymer properties (e.g., introducing crosslinking sites or reactive handles).

name: Methyl Methacrylate (MMA)
discription: Methyl Methacrylate is an organic compound, the methyl ester of methacrylic acid. It is a colorless, volatile liquid primarily used as a monomer for the production of poly(methyl methacrylate) (PMMA), also known as acrylic glass or Plexiglas.
typical_properties: Formula Weight: 100.12, Flash Point: 10°C, Boiling point: 100°C, Density (20°C): 0.944, Vapour Pressure (25°C, from table): 29 (unit uncertain), Surface Tension (25°C): 23.5 dynes/cm. Physical Properties: Colorless liquid.
pharmaceutical_industry: Monomer for PMMA used in bone cements, dental prosthetics, intraocular lenses, and some controlled-release drug formulations. Also used to synthesize copolymers for pharmaceutical applications.
other_industries: Primary monomer for PMMA (acrylic sheets, resins, molding powders); production of acrylic paints, coatings, adhesives, and impact modifiers for other plastics (e.g., PVC).

name: Methacrylic Acid (MAA)
discription: Methacrylic Acid is an organic carboxylic acid. It is a colorless, viscous liquid with an acrid, unpleasant odor. It is used as a monomer for various polymers.
typical_properties: Formula Weight: 86.089, Flash Point: 77°C, Boiling point: 160°C, Density (20°C): Not specified in table directly for this value (typo with 1.414 in density column, which appears to be MMA's value). Vapour Pressure (25°C, from table): 1.2 (unit uncertain), Surface Tension (25°C): 30.9 dynes/cm. Physical Properties: Colorless crystals or clear liquid.
pharmaceutical_industry: Used as a comonomer in the synthesis of pH-sensitive polymers for enteric coatings on tablets and capsules (e.g., Eudragit polymers), ensuring targeted drug release. Used in dental adhesives and restoratives.
other_industries: Monomer for producing poly(methacrylic acid) and copolymers used in paints, coatings, adhesives, ion-exchange resins, flocculants, soil conditioners, and textile sizing.

name: Dodecyl Methacrylate (LMA)
discription: Dodecyl Methacrylate (Lauryl Methacrylate) is a long-chain alkyl methacrylate monomer. It is used to impart hydrophobicity, flexibility, and adhesion to polymers.
typical_properties: Formula Weight: 254.408, Flash Point: 80°C, Boiling point: 142°C, Density (20°C): 0.868, Vapour Pressure (25°C, from table): 0.7 (unit uncertain), Surface Tension (25°C): 29.5 dynes/cm. Physical Properties: transparency liquid.
other_industries: Comonomer in the production of acrylic polymers for coatings, adhesives, sealants, oil additives (viscosity index improvers, pour point depressants), and plastics; imparts hydrophobicity and flexibility.

name: Butyl Methacrylate (N-BMA)
discription: n-Butyl Methacrylate is an ester of methacrylic acid. It is a clear, colorless liquid used as a monomer in the production of acrylic polymers.
typical_properties: Formula Weight: 142.2, Flash Point: 23°C, Boiling point: 165°C, Density (20°C): 0.895, Vapour Pressure (25°C, from table): 2 (unit uncertain), Surface Tension (25°C): 26.4 dynes/cm. Physical Properties: Transparent colorless liquid.
other_industries: Monomer for manufacturing acrylic polymers and copolymers used in paints, coatings, adhesives, sealants, textiles, and specialty plastics; provides good weather resistance and flexibility.

name: Isobutyl Methacrylate
discription: Isobutyl Methacrylate is an ester of methacrylic acid, used as a monomer in polymer synthesis to impart specific properties like hardness and gloss.
typical_properties: Formula Weight: 142.2 (Abbr. in table: divination -BAA), Flash Point: 107°C, Boiling point: 155°C, Density (20°C): 0.9, Vapour Pressure (25°C, from table): 3.5 (unit uncertain), Surface Tension (25°C): 25.4 dynes/cm. Physical Properties: Bravery colorless liquid.
other_industries: Monomer for acrylic polymers used in coatings, resins, adhesives, and dental materials; contributes to hardness, gloss, and chemical resistance.

name: 2-Hydroxyethyl methacrylate (HEMA)
discription: 2-Hydroxyethyl methacrylate is a hydrophilic monomer containing both methacrylate and hydroxyl groups. It readily polymerizes and is a key component in hydrogel production.
typical_properties: Formula Weight: 130.142, Flash Point: 108°C, Boiling point: 95°C, Density (20°C): 1.1, Vapour Pressure (25°C, from table): 0.9 (unit uncertain), Surface Tension (25°C): 33.7 dynes/cm. Physical Properties: Colorless liquid.
pharmaceutical_industry: Extensively used in biomedical applications, including the production of soft contact lenses, hydrogels for drug delivery, dental materials, and coatings for medical devices due to its biocompatibility and hydrophilicity.
other_industries: Monomer for acrylic resins, coatings (UV-curable), adhesives, and photopolymer printing plates; reactive diluent.

name: 2-Hydroxypropyl methacrylate, mixture of isomers (HPMA)
discription: 2-Hydroxypropyl methacrylate (mixture of isomers) is a hydrophilic monomer similar to HEMA, used in polymer synthesis to incorporate hydroxyl functionality.
typical_properties: Formula Weight: 144.168, Flash Point: 96°C, Boiling point: 96°C, Density (20°C): 1.066, Vapour Pressure (25°C, from table): 0.9 (unit uncertain), Surface Tension (25°C): 32.3 dynes/cm. Physical Properties: Colorless liquid.
pharmaceutical_industry: Used in the synthesis of polymers for biomedical applications, including hydrogels, dental materials, and drug delivery systems. Provides hydroxyl groups for further modification or crosslinking.
other_industries: Monomer for acrylic resins, coatings, adhesives, and reactive systems; used to improve adhesion, flexibility, and hydrophilicity of polymers.

name: Isobornyl Methacrylate (I-BOMA)
discription: Isobornyl Methacrylate is a cyclic aliphatic methacrylate monomer known for imparting hardness, abrasion resistance, and good weatherability to polymers.
typical_properties: Formula Weight: 222.323, Flash Point: 104°C, Boiling point: 127-129°C, Density (20°C): Not specified directly (likely close to 1), Vapour Pressure (25°C, from table): 0.01 (unit uncertain), Surface Tension (25°C): 32.4 dynes/cm. Physical Properties: Yellow liquid.
other_industries: Monomer for producing polymers used in high-performance coatings (automotive, industrial), inks, adhesives, and composites; offers excellent hardness, chemical resistance, and optical clarity.

name: Benzyl Methacrylate (BZMA/BNMA)
discription: Benzyl Methacrylate is an aromatic methacrylate monomer. It is used to increase the refractive index, hardness, and chemical resistance of polymers.
typical_properties: Formula Weight: 176.212, Flash Point: 107.2°C, Boiling point: 231-233°C, Density (20°C): 1.04, Vapour Pressure (25°C, from table): 0.5 (unit uncertain), Surface Tension (25°C): 34.7 dynes/cm. Physical Properties: Colorless liquid.
other_industries: Monomer for acrylic polymers used in optical applications (lenses, prisms), specialty coatings, adhesives, and dental resins due to its ability to modify refractive index and enhance hardness.

name: Iso-Octyl Methacrylate (EHMA)
discription: Iso-Octyl Methacrylate (often refers to 2-Ethylhexyl Methacrylate if EHMA is used, though true iso-octyl is branched differently) is a long-chain alkyl methacrylate monomer. It imparts flexibility, water resistance, and adhesion to polymers.
typical_properties: Formula Weight: 198.302, Flash Point: 91.4°C, Boiling point: 247°C, Density (20°C): 0.879, Vapour Pressure (25°C, from table): 0.0263 (unit uncertain), Surface Tension (25°C): Not specified in column. Physical Properties: Colorless liquid.
other_industries: Comonomer in the production of acrylic polymers for pressure-sensitive adhesives, coatings, sealants, and oil additives; provides tack, flexibility, and low-temperature performance.

name: Cyclohexyl Methacrylate (CHMA)
discription: Cyclohexyl Methacrylate is a cycloaliphatic methacrylate monomer that provides hardness, abrasion resistance, and good weatherability to acrylic polymers.
typical_properties: Formula Weight: 168.233, Flash Point: 90°C, Boiling point: 210°C, Density (20°C): 0.9626, Vapour Pressure (25°C, from table): Not specified in column. Surface Tension (25°C): 30.5 dynes/cm. Physical Properties: White transparent liquid.
other_industries: Monomer for acrylic polymers used in coatings (automotive, industrial), adhesives, optical plastics, and dental resins; contributes to high gloss, hardness, and chemical resistance.

name: Tertiary-Butyl Methacrylate (TBMA)
discription: Tertiary-Butyl Methacrylate is a bulky methacrylate monomer that imparts rigidity, chemical resistance, and hydrophobicity to polymers.
typical_properties: Formula Weight: 142.196, Flash Point: 41.1±7°C, Boiling point: 132°C, Density (20°C): 0.875, Vapour Pressure (25°C, from table): 2.8 (unit uncertain), Surface Tension (25°C): 24.9 dynes/cm. Physical Properties: Colorless liquid.
other_industries: Monomer for specialty acrylic polymers used in coatings, adhesives, and plastics where high hardness, solvent resistance, and hydrolytic stability are required.

name: 2-Ethylhexyl Acrylate (2-EHA)
discription: 2-Ethylhexyl Acrylate is a common acrylic monomer used to produce soft, tacky polymers. It is a colorless liquid with a characteristic acrid odor.
typical_properties: Formula Weight: 184.275, Flash Point: 86°C, Boiling point: 238°C, Density (20°C): 8.845 (This value is unusually high for density g/cm³, typical 2-EHA density is ~0.885 g/cm³; likely a typo or refers to a different scale. Will use 0.885 from common knowledge if needed but transcribe from table for now.), Vapour Pressure (25°C, from table): 0.15 (unit uncertain), Surface Tension (25°C): 27.9 dynes/cm. Physical Properties: Colorless liquid.
other_industries: Major monomer for acrylic emulsion polymers used in pressure-sensitive adhesives, coatings (architectural, industrial), textiles, sealants, and construction materials; provides flexibility and tack.

name: 2-Hydroxyethyl Acrylate (HEA)
discription: 2-Hydroxyethyl Acrylate is a hydrophilic functional monomer containing both an acrylate and a hydroxyl group. It is used to introduce hydroxyl functionality into acrylic polymers.
typical_properties: Formula Weight: 116.115, Flash Point: 98.3°C, Boiling point: 92°C, Density (20°C): 1.1, Vapour Pressure (25°C, from table): <0.1 (unit uncertain), Surface Tension (25°C): 35.4 dynes/cm. Physical Properties: Colorless liquid.
pharmaceutical_industry: Used in the synthesis of hydrophilic polymers for biomedical applications such as hydrogels, contact lenses, and drug delivery systems. The hydroxyl group allows for crosslinking and further modification.
other_industries: Monomer for acrylic resins used in automotive coatings (crosslinkable site), industrial coatings, adhesives, and photocurable resins (UV/EB); improves adhesion, flexibility, and impact resistance.

name: Hydroxypropyl Acrylate, mixture of isomers (HPA)
discription: Hydroxypropyl Acrylate (mixture of isomers) is a functional acrylic monomer similar to HEA, providing hydroxyl groups for crosslinking and property modification in polymers.
typical_properties: Formula Weight: 130.142, Flash Point: 79.9°C, Boiling point: 77°C, Density (20°C): 1.1, Vapour Pressure (25°C, from table): Not specified directly in column. Surface Tension (25°C): 35.2 dynes/cm. Physical Properties: Colorless liquid.
pharmaceutical_industry: Used in creating polymers for biomedical devices and drug delivery systems where hydroxyl functionality is desired for biocompatibility or further reactions.
other_industries: Monomer for acrylic resins in coatings, adhesives, and thermosetting compositions; reactive diluent; improves adhesion and flexibility.

name: Methacrylamide (MMAmide)
discription: Methacrylamide is an amide derivative of methacrylic acid. It is a crystalline solid used as a monomer to produce poly(methacrylamide) and various copolymers.
typical_properties: Formula Weight: 85.104, Flash Point: 1°C, Boiling point: 7±19.8°C (BP value is very unusual, typical BP for Methacrylamide is much higher, ~215°C or sublimes; this is likely a typo for a property like melting point range or a very low pressure BP), Density (20°C): 215 (This cannot be density g/cm³, maybe kg/m³ or just an error), Vapour Pressure (25°C, from table): 1.115 (unit uncertain), Surface Tension (25°C): 29.6 dynes/cm. Physical Properties: Colorless liquid (Contradicts typical solid form).
pharmaceutical_industry: Monomer for polymers used in hydrogels for drug delivery and biomedical applications. Copolymers can exhibit temperature or pH sensitivity.
other_industries: Monomer for producing poly(methacrylamide) and copolymers used as flocculants in water treatment, soil conditioners, thickening agents, and in the paper and textile industries. Crosslinking agent.

name: Methyl Acrylate (MA)
discription: Methyl Acrylate is an organic compound, the methyl ester of acrylic acid. It is a colorless, volatile liquid with a characteristic acrid odor. It is used as a monomer for acrylic polymers.
typical_properties: Formula Weight: 86.089, Flash Point: 6.7°C, Boiling point: 80.5°C, Density (20°C): 0.95, Vapour Pressure (25°C, from table): 9.1 (unit uncertain), Surface Tension (25°C): 23.4 dynes/cm. Physical Properties: Colorless liquid.
other_industries: Monomer for producing poly(methyl acrylate) and copolymers used in paints, coatings, adhesives, textiles, leather finishing, and plastics; imparts softness and tackiness.

name: Ethyl Acrylate (EA)
discription: Ethyl Acrylate is an organic compound, the ethyl ester of acrylic acid. It is a colorless liquid with a characteristic acrid odor, used primarily as a monomer for various polymers.
typical_properties: Formula Weight: 100.116, Flash Point: 9°C, Boiling point: 99.4°C, Density (20°C): 0.92, Vapour Pressure (25°C, from table): 3.9 (unit uncertain), Surface Tension (25°C): 24.8 dynes/cm. Physical Properties: Colorless liquid.
other_industries: Monomer for producing acrylic polymers and copolymers used in latex paints, coatings, adhesives, textiles, paper coatings, and synthetic rubber; provides flexibility and elasticity.

name: Butyl Acrylate (BA)
discription: n-Butyl Acrylate is an organic compound, the n-butyl ester of acrylic acid. It is a clear, colorless liquid with a characteristic fruity odor, primarily used as a monomer for acrylic polymers.
typical_properties: Formula Weight: 28.169 (This FW is incorrect for C7H12O2, which should be 128.17 g/mol. The table has a significant typo here.), Flash Point: 36°C, Boiling point: 145-149°C, Density (20°C): Not specified directly. Vapour Pressure (25°C, from table): 0.44 (unit uncertain), Surface Tension (25°C): 26.7 dynes/cm. Physical Properties: Colorless liquid.
other_industries: Monomer for producing acrylic polymers and copolymers used in paints, coatings, adhesives (pressure-sensitive), sealants, textiles, and elastomers; imparts softness, flexibility, and tack.

name: Acrylic Acid (essential acid) (AA)
discription: Acrylic Acid is an organic compound, the simplest unsaturated carboxylic acid. It is a colorless liquid with a characteristic acrid or tart smell. It is miscible with water, alcohols, ethers, and chloroform.
typical_properties: Formula Weight: 72.063, Flash Point: 54°C, Boiling point: 141°C, Density (20°C): 1.1 (likely for glacial; solution densities vary), Vapour Pressure (25°C, from table): 3.4 (unit uncertain), Surface Tension (25°C): 32.8 dynes/cm. Physical Properties: Colorless liquid.
pharmaceutical_industry: Monomer for poly(acrylic acid) (PAA) and copolymers (carbomers) which are widely used as thickening agents, suspending agents, emulsifiers, bioadhesives, and in controlled-release drug delivery systems (e.g., oral tablets, topical gels).
other_industries: Key monomer for producing superabsorbent polymers (SAPs) for diapers and hygiene products; used in detergents, flocculants for water treatment, dispersants, coatings, adhesives, and textiles.
